did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle:
American Planning and Civic Association records,
1909-1970
did.physdesc: Scrapbooks, pamphlets, publications, bulletins, papers and correspondence.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Scrapbooks, pamphlets, publications, bulletins, papers and correspondence of the American Planning and Civic Association. Correspondents include General Ulysses S. Grant III, Harland Bartholomew, and Harlean James.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The National League for Civic Improvement was established in 1900, and merged with the American Park and Outdoor Association in 1904 to form the American Civic Association. In 1935, this organization merged with the National Conference on City Planning to form the American Planning and Civic Association, which was later joined by the National Conference on City Planning. The American Planning and Civic Association later merged with Action, Inc., the State Urban Action Center, and Urban America, forming the National Urban Coalition.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Scrapbooks, pamphlets, publications, bulletins, papers and correspondence of the American Planning and Civic Association. Correspondents include General Ulysses S. Grant III, Harland Bartholomew, and Harlean James.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: American Planning and Civic Association Records, #2777. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
